result.execSummary:
The defendant Margaret J. Meisel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE requests expungment.  No objection. If DE successfully completes and strictly complies with probation, DE may renew request for expungment.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program or obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of Probation. 
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
Perform 100 hours of community service work for a public agency or nonprofit charitable organization. Credit to be determined upon revocation. May not associate with drug users. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No drug paraphenalia.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Margaret J. Meisel

defendant.name: Meisel, Margaret J.
defendant.address: c/o Cindy Sebena 4609 29th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53140

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Watson.   Clerk HMcBride.  On state's motion, ct 1 is DRI.  DE enters guilty plea to cts 2 and 3.  Court finds DE guilty of cts 2 and 3.  Court withholds sentence on cts 2 and 3 and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions; as it relates to ct 2 - DE ordered to complete 100 hrs of community service as a condition of probation; credit to be determined upon revocation;   DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court.  DE requests expungement. No objection.  If DE successfully completes and strictly complies with probation, DE may renew request for expungement. Court may set a hearing and if satisfied, grant expungement.    Appeal rights given.

01:08 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk JT  Minutes: Information filed today receipt acknowledged, reading waived.   Plea of Not Guilty entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney. Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm. rb

Defendant Margaret J. Meisel appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information to be filed  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Margaret J. Meisel appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Watson requests adjournment due to new charges for DE.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
